div.p: This case-sensitive code system https://mitre.org/fhir/space-health/CodeSystem/space-psychological-effects-cs defines the following codes:

tr.td: Anxiety specifically related to the confined conditions of spacecraft
Prolonged stress experienced during extended space missions
Psychological effects of not being able to see Earth during deep space missions
Problems with interpersonal relationships and group dynamics during spaceflight
Cumulative fatigue, both physical and mental, experienced during long-duration missions
A condition characterized by weakness, fatigue, and emotional lability during long-duration spaceflight
Overall mental and behavioral well-being during spaceflight
Psychological effects of delayed communications with Earth during deep space missions
A period of decreased motivation and morale that often occurs after the midpoint of a mission
Positive psychological effects and personal growth experienced during spaceflight
Intense feelings of bliss and connectedness reported by some astronauts, particularly during spacewalks
Profound cognitive shift in awareness reported by astronauts while viewing Earth from space

description.value: CodeSystem for space psychological effects not found in SNOMED CT

definition.value: Anxiety specifically related to the confined conditions of spacecraft

A period of decreased motivation and morale that often occurs after the midpoint of a mission
Positive psychological effects and personal growth experienced during spaceflight
Intense feelings of bliss and connectedness reported by some astronauts, particularly during spacewalks
Profound cognitive shift in awareness reported by astronauts while viewing Earth from space
